definition: to fascinate/to strongly attract/to obsess/to infatuate/to captivate/to enchant
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: He was enthralled by the exciting story.
sentences.chinese: 他被小說迷住了，整夜未眠。

sentences.english: I was he witched by an electrical outlet that screamed out to me to stick in my little finger.
sentences.chinese: 我被一個電插座迷住了，它朝我直叫，讓我很惱火。

sentences.english: Helen was attracted by Paris" lovely face."
sentences.chinese: 海倫被帕利斯可愛的面容迷住。

sentences.english: The boy was enthralled by the stories of adventure.
sentences.chinese: 這孩子被冒險故事迷住了。

sentences.english: The gentleman is besotted by a beautiful young girl.
sentences.chinese: 這位紳士被一位美女迷住了。

sentences.english: Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.
sentences.chinese: 愚蒙迷住孩童的心，用管教的杖可以遠遠趕除。

sentences.english: The boys drooled over the sports cars in the showroom.
sentences.chinese: 那些男孩給陳列室裏的跑車迷住了。

sentences.english: He is enamoured by that enchantress.
At the sight of her matchless beauty, both the princes were bewitched.
sentences.chinese: 看見她美麗無比的容顏時，兩個王子都被迷住了。

sentences.english: With ingenuous sincerity, he captivated his audience.
sentences.chinese: 他以自己的率真迷住了觀衆。

sentences.english: The country girl stood by the road, mesmerized at the speed of cars racing past.
sentences.chinese: 村姑站在路旁被疾駛而過的一輛輛車迷住了。
她的美貌立刻迷住了他。

sentences.english: He was ravished by her beauty.
The doctors were charmed by her undefeatable spirit.
sentences.chinese: 醫生們也被她不可戰勝的精神迷住了。

sentences.english: A fascinated creature is entranced by a supernatural or spell effect.
sentences.chinese: 著迷狀態是指被超自然能力或是法術能力給迷住了。

definition: lit. spirit and soul upside down (idiom); infatuated and head over heels in love/fascinated/captivated
to knock sb out with a drug/to render sb unconscious
to be infatuated with/to be enchanted by/to be passionate about
to be infatuated with/to be drunk with/to be enchanted with/to revel in
to look upon/to take a fancy to/to fall for
